Sequence Information.Peptide Name: D16W (GGN4 analogue peptide with single substitution)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.12199716]Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC=25 µg/ml), Bacillus subtilis (MIC=2.5 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC=10 µg/ml), Shigella dysentariae (MIC=10 µg/ml), Pseudomonas putida (MIC=100 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC=50 µg/ml), Eshchericia coli (MIC=10 µg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium (MIC=50 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.12199716] 1.97% hemolytic activity at 10 µg/mL, 52.9% hemolytic activity at 100 µg/mL against human red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Single substitution of aspartic acid 16 by tryptophan (D16W) in the native GGN4. Has hemolytic activity as well as the antimicrobial activity.

Literature.Title: Effects of a tryptophanyl substitution on the structure and antimicrobial activity of C-terminally truncated gaegurin 4.
Literature.Author: Won HS, Park SH, Kim HE, Hyun B, Kim M, Lee BJ, Lee BJ.
